name: executory
content:
executory adjective
(AGREED)
Add to word list
Add to word list
law, business
  specialized A law, agreement, etc. that is executory has been agreed, but does not yet have an effect and will begin in future: executory contract We would like some flexibility to cancel executory contracts. Some judgements may be modified after becoming executory.
More examplesFewer examplesThe new law has already become final and executory.

executory adjective
(ADMINISTRATIVE)
relating to the arrangements for making decisions and managing businesses: Only they have the executory power to make a decision about this matter. You will need to pay property taxes and other executory costs related to the sale of the house. Synonyms
administrative
executive
More examplesFewer examplesAnyone who holds an executory title of ownership can legally sell the ship.
